character.statement: What are you trying to teach them?
I'm on it, teach!
Hey, that's not how this is supposed to work.
What nightmares?
Where might someone find a Poptropica script?
Settle down, class. Today we're going to study the poem "O Captain! My Captain!"
I know I can get through to these kids. I'm going to change their lives.
The classic poem "O Captain! My Captain!" I'm hoping it will foster a love of poetry. Y'know, as an educator, I really prefer the Socratic method...
Argh! That's the only copy I had... I'm going to need more soda pop to get through this day.
That's an old writer's trick. Always give the player something to search for. Hint hint.
O Player! O Player! Find me some soda!
Thanks, but that's not enough to get me back in the game.
You did bring me the soda pop... but I'm afraid that if I go back, the nightmares will return.
I used to have nightmares about typos in the Poptropica scripts. I'd stay in the office all night correcting them! Why, if I saw a script right now, I'd have no choice but to correct it!
I always put them where they belong â€“ in the trash! Hint hint.
I always put the scripts in the trash!
So many typos! Who typed this, a three-toed sloth? I need to get to my writing station!
Oh my... All my hard work, it really meant something to you kids... It was all worth it.
This did not go as I had hoped...
No way! We want to play Mega Fighting Bots!
My bot will crush your bot!
O captain! My captain! Our fearful trip is done.
That wasn't for you. It was for this other one. Now that you quit, we can play Mega Fighting Bots all day!
When I grow up, I'm going to be a pro gamer!
LOL, you're bad at games!
Mega Fighting Bots! Mega Fighting Bots!
No way, you noob. My bot is level 87!
The ship has weather'd every rack, the prize we sought is won.
Mega Fighting Bots! Mega Fighting Bots!
Mega Fighting Bots is the Mega Fighting Best!
My mom says children are the future. Then she shakes her head.
I never get a turn to play.
Don't tell anyone, but I actually wanted to study the poem.
